newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian castor falls on better new crop prospects.
newsitem.headline: Indian castor falls on better new crop prospects.

text.p: Indian castorseed March delivery prices fell to 1,170/1,171 rupees per quintal from 1,176/1,177 rupees on expectations of improved new crop arrivals after a local festival, dealers said.
Sluggish overseas buying prompted light bull liquidation.
Tuesday marks the kite festival in India. Groundnut oil was steady at 350/352 rupees per 10 kg on limited arrivals of 40/50 tonnes, while offtake was low.
The closure of markets in producing centres due to the kite festival curtailed arrivals in the Bombay market. Imported palm oil was steady at 289/290 rupees per 10 kg on restricted trade.
